etymology.description: 扌(扌) (shǒu, "hand") + 巴(巴) (bā) = combining hand with phonetic value -> disposal marker
etymology.interpretation: The character 把(bǎ) combines the hand radical 扌(扌) (shǒu, "hand"), indicating an action involving the hand, with the phonetic 巴(巴) (bā), providing the pronunciation. This suggests a hand's role in manipulating or handling something, which fits its function as a disposal marker in sentences.

examples.chinese: 我把水喝了(我把水喝了)。
他把信寄出去了(他把信寄出去了)，朋友很快收到了(朋友很快收到了)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bǎ xìn jì chū qù le, péngyǒu hěn kuài shōu dào le.
examples.english: He sent out the letter, and his friend received it quickly.

examples.chinese: 我把烦恼放下了(我把煩惱放下了)，心情变得轻松起来了(心情變得輕鬆起來了)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ bǎ fánnǎo fàng xià le, xīnqíng biàn dé qīngsōng qǐ lái le.
examples.english: I put aside my worries, and my mood became relaxed.
